definition: compasses, set square, spirit level and plumbline (idiom); fig. established standard/norms/criteria

sentences.english: The third newcomer -- the United States -- based itself squarely on republican principles.
sentences.chinese: 第三個國家便是美國，它完全建立在共和準繩基礎上。

sentences.english: There can be no question of holding forth on ethics.
sentences.chinese: 這裏談不上堅守道德準繩的問題。

sentences.english: This is an important yardstick against which all reform proposals should be measured.
sentences.chinese: 這是衡量一切改革措施的重要準繩。

sentences.english: Real results should be the yardstick for measuring success.
sentences.chinese: 真實的成果是衡量成功的準繩。

sentences.english: Criterion on the mat had better not be expanded after the injection of the other.
sentences.chinese: 準繩上墊過膨體之後最好不要再注射其它。

sentences.english: Therefore thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in the congregation of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 所以，在耶和華的會中，你必沒有人拈鬮拉準繩。

sentences.english: The correct yardstick is just for this moment.
sentences.chinese: 正確的準繩只是這一刻。

sentences.english: Never forget, the Man with the measuring line is with us today. --- J. G . M.
sentences.chinese: 不要忘記，那手拿準繩的今天仍和我們同在。

sentences.english: Cosmetics yardstick not afford to go any role in this regard.
sentences.chinese: 化裝品對此在準繩上不起任何作用。

sentences.english: He deviconsumedd from society by to come to be drug mistreatr.
sentences.chinese: 他成爲一名吸毒者，從而違抗了社會德性準繩。

sentences.english: They set the standard by which the Heat measure themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他們樹立的標準，將是熱火隊衡量自己的準繩。
不過，撒切爾還是以自己的準繩貫徹實施了法律。

definition: (Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
